column2: for that was the name of Margaret's eldest son
column3: took his mother's hand and called his six little brothers
column4: and together they went through Elmond wood as fast as ever they could go. It may be that the mother led the way
column5: it may be that so it chanced
column6: but soon they had left the greenwood far behind and stood on an open heath. And there
column8: stood a castle.Margaret looked and Margaret smiled. She knew she was standing once again before her father's gate.She took three rings from her pocket and gave them to her eldest wee boy.'Give one
column11: but so he sees the ring
column12: he will open the gate and let you enter.'Give another to the butler
column14: and he will show you where ye are to go.
